column4: If I dual boot Ubuntu/Windows XP using Wubi, will there be performance issues on XP?
no, but if you use Wubi, there will be performance issues on Ubuntu,  you may not notice them though
that's one reason why it's better to use a proper partitioend install instead :)
yes and most people don't want to just get rid of Ubuntu either, once they have tried it
in fact many will want to get rid of Windows once trying it
I've been using Ubuntu for a few days and if I was forced to make the choice, windows would win outright. I'm a gamer :P
this idea that Ubuntu  or other Linux distros sucks for gaming, isn't really  true
since there are quite a lot of good native games, plus  it is possible to have a lot of Windows games working well in Wine
also apparnatly its better to play games on a console than on a PC
a lot of games will work in a WIndows virtual machine also
ok  3D gaming is a bit hrm at the moment, but that's getting there,  and depending on your hardware, that may work well now
most or all 2D games for Windows though, I expect will work well in a Windows virtual machine
so dual boot with Windows if you want, and use that for gaming,  and  a Linux distro, for actsaul computing?
there are quite a few good native Linux 3D games :)
they have done a Steam for Mac, and I have read that Steam for Linux is coming soon
if the support pages mention Linux, they are probably also rather out to date
I have read quite a lot of recent stuff, that is saying that Steam for Linux is coming
soon
also you can run Steam in Wine quite well, as far as I know
since quite a lot of people do that
if you must use propritary games,  and won't use Wine or  a Windows virtual machine,  fine just use Windows on a pshyical install for that.
for actsaul computing though, Linux distros tend to be better :)
